title: Trump Shows "Strong And Deep" Support For Hegseth Amid Controversies
content: Hegeth had spent the week meeting senators and trying to gain some support amid the flurry of backlash he has been facing for the sexual assault, alcohol abuse and financial mismanagement accusations.
summary: Hegeth had spent the week meeting senators and trying to gain some support amid the flurry of backlash he has been facing for the sexual assault, alcohol abuse and financial mismanagement accusations.

title: Iran "Dramatically" Hiking Amount Of Enriched Uranium: Nuclear Body Chief
content: Iran is "dramatically" increasing the amount of uranium enriched to up to 60% purity, close to the roughly 90% of weapons grade, that it is able to produce, the watchdog's chief Rafael Grossi told Reuters in an interview.
summary: Iran is "dramatically" increasing the amount of uranium enriched to up to 60% purity, close to the roughly 90% of weapons grade, that it is able to produce, the watchdog's chief Rafael Grossi told Reuters in an interview.

title: 57-Year-Old Italian Nun Arrested Over Links To Powerful Mafia Network
content: A nun in Italy has been arrested on suspicion of being part of a criminal gang which had links to the country's most powerful mafia network, the 'Ndrangheta.
summary: A nun in Italy has been arrested on suspicion of being part of a criminal gang which had links to the country's most powerful mafia network, the 'Ndrangheta.

title: Ukraine Unveils New 700 Km Range "Rocket-Drone" To Strike Deeper Into Russia
content: Ukraine showed off a new locally-produced "rocket-drone" on Friday which it said could fly 700 km (430 miles) - more than twice the longest range attributed to missiles supplied by Western allies.
summary: Ukraine showed off a new locally-produced "rocket-drone" on Friday which it said could fly 700 km (430 miles) - more than twice the longest range attributed to missiles supplied by Western allies.

title: Putin Replaces Kursk Governor, Cites Need For "Crisis" Manager
content: President Vladimir Putin has replaced the governor of the Kursk region -- partly controlled by Ukraine -- saying it needs a "crisis" manager, after residents voiced anger at the handling of the incursion.
summary: President Vladimir Putin has replaced the governor of the Kursk region -- partly controlled by Ukraine -- saying it needs a "crisis" manager, after residents voiced anger at the handling of the incursion.

title: Netanyahu Links Synagogue Attack In Australia To "Anti-Israel Sentiment"
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Friday linked an arson attack on a synagogue in Australia to what he called Canberra's "anti-Israel sentiment".
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Friday linked an arson attack on a synagogue in Australia to what he called Canberra's "anti-Israel sentiment".

title: Prince William To Attend Notre Dame Cathedral Reopening In Paris
content: The UK's Prince William will attend Saturday's re-opening of Notre Dame cathedral in Paris, Kensington Palace said on Friday, but his wife, Catherine, will not accompany him.
summary: The UK's Prince William will attend Saturday's re-opening of Notre Dame cathedral in Paris, Kensington Palace said on Friday, but his wife, Catherine, will not accompany him.

title: Trump's NASA Pick, Musk's Business Partner, May Face Political Challenges
content: Donald Trump's pick to helm NASA, a private astronaut and close ally of Elon Musk's SpaceX, is a central figure of a speedy, commercial-focused side of the space industry who would face unfamiliar political challenges as an administrator.
summary: Donald Trump's pick to helm NASA, a private astronaut and close ally of Elon Musk's SpaceX, is a central figure of a speedy, commercial-focused side of the space industry who would face unfamiliar political challenges as an administrator.

title: "Masood Azhar's Speech Exposes Pak's Duplicity": India's Stern Response
content: India on Friday demanded that Pakistan act against terrorist Masood Azhar, chief of banned terrorism group Jaish-e-Mohammed and the mastermind behind terror strikes like the 2011 Parliament attack.
summary: India on Friday demanded that Pakistan act against terrorist Masood Azhar, chief of banned terrorism group Jaish-e-Mohammed and the mastermind behind terror strikes like the 2011 Parliament attack.

title: In A 1st, BJP Says US State Department Behind "Deep State" Targeting India
content: BJP, which leads the coalition of parties currently in Government in India, has directly accused the US State Department of trying to "destabilise India". It also claimed that the US "deep state" is working to "target Prime Minister Narendra Modi".
summary: BJP, which leads the coalition of parties currently in Government in India, has directly accused the US State Department of trying to "destabilise India". It also claimed that the US "deep state" is working to "target Prime Minister Narendra Modi".

title: What It Means For Bangladesh To Drop Mujibur Rahman From Currency Notes
content: This is a big decision taken by the Bangladesh government because Rahman has been a part of the currency since the country's inception on March 4th, 1972.
summary: This is a big decision taken by the Bangladesh government because Rahman has been a part of the currency since the country's inception on March 4th, 1972.

title: US School Teacher Claims She Was Fired Over Anti-Trump Post On Facebook
content: A US high school teacher has claimed that she was fired over a Facebook post she made criticising president-elect Donald Trump and his followers.
summary: A US high school teacher has claimed that she was fired over a Facebook post she made criticising president-elect Donald Trump and his followers.

title: Ship Carrying Norwegian Arms For Ukraine Aid Runs Aground
content: A cargo ship loaded with Norwegian weapons destined to protect a Polish logistics hub that distributes military aid to Ukraine has run aground off Norway's coast, authorities said Friday.
summary: A cargo ship loaded with Norwegian weapons destined to protect a Polish logistics hub that distributes military aid to Ukraine has run aground off Norway's coast, authorities said Friday.

title: What To Expect As Doors To Notre-Dame Reopens In Paris After 5 Years
content: Paris' Notre-Dame Cathedral reopens on Saturday, December 7, five and a half years after fire destroyed its roof and spire and caused major damage throughout.
summary: Paris' Notre-Dame Cathedral reopens on Saturday, December 7, five and a half years after fire destroyed its roof and spire and caused major damage throughout.

title: Watch: Influencer Leaves Jewellery On Car Bonnet To Test Dubai's Safety
content: A video showcasing Dubai's safety is going viral on social media, sparking a lively discussion among netizens. In the clip, influencer Leyla Afshonkar stages a prank to test the city's safety.
summary: A video showcasing Dubai's safety is going viral on social media, sparking a lively discussion among netizens. In the clip, influencer Leyla Afshonkar stages a prank to test the city's safety.

title: Putin To Hold Annual Press Conference On December 19, Says Kremlin
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin will hold his annual press conference on December 19, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said in televised comments Friday, saying it will include foreign media.
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin will hold his annual press conference on December 19, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said in televised comments Friday, saying it will include foreign media.

title: Historic Roman Aureus Featuring Brutus, Heads For Auction In Geneva
content: The aureus, gold currency used in ancient Rome, weighing 8 grams, is one of only 17 known examples and features Brutus's profile framed with laurel leaves on one side, celebrating his military victories on the other.
summary: The aureus, gold currency used in ancient Rome, weighing 8 grams, is one of only 17 known examples and features Brutus's profile framed with laurel leaves on one side, celebrating his military victories on the other.

title: South Korea's Opposition Leader Warns Of Another Martial Law Attempt
content: South Korea's main opposition leader Lee Jae-myung warned that President Yoon Suk Yeol might make another attempt to declare martial law before parliament votes on impeaching him on Saturday.
summary: South Korea's main opposition leader Lee Jae-myung warned that President Yoon Suk Yeol might make another attempt to declare martial law before parliament votes on impeaching him on Saturday.

title: Massive Search In New York To Find Suspect Who Shot UnitedHealth CEO
content: Armed with a growing file of clues, New York police on Friday were scouring surveillance videos and asking the public for help in their search for the masked assailant who gunned down a UnitedHealth executive on a Midtown Manhattan sidewalk.
summary: Armed with a growing file of clues, New York police on Friday were scouring surveillance videos and asking the public for help in their search for the masked assailant who gunned down a UnitedHealth executive on a Midtown Manhattan sidewalk.

title: Hong Kong Court Dismisses First Legal Challenge To New Security Law
content: A senior Hong Kong judge sided with the government on Friday and dismissed the first legal challenge to the city's newly enacted national security law, which had been brought by a jailed protester.
summary: A senior Hong Kong judge sided with the government on Friday and dismissed the first legal challenge to the city's newly enacted national security law, which had been brought by a jailed protester.
